STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 18, 2025
Stella GAZETTE Daniels
ST CLAIR COUNTY DHHS
220 FORT ST,
PORT HURON, MI, 48060-3850
RE: License#: CP740201421
Dear Stella GAZETTE Daniels:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 04/17/2025 . The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency interim evaluation was completed 07/02/2024. Areas identified in
noncompliance as a part of that review were 418(2)(a)(b), and 405(5). The
corrective action plan submitted to address these areas of noncompliance was
approved by DCWL 09/06/2024. None of these 3 areas were identified in
noncompliance as a part of this renewal evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment

The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The Chief Administrator
Assessment included a review of the agency's compliance related to action steps
associated with areas identified in noncompliance as a part of the interim
evaluation. Progress was noted in each area with a commitment to continue with
each action step.
Financial Overview
Not applicable.
Staff Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff interviews
did not indicate any areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and independent living services. All files were
stored securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1: The home needed additional smoke detectors.
Resolution: Smoke detectors were provided and installed with picture
documentation confirmation.
Safety Alert #2: The home needed additional smoke detectors.
Resolution: Smoke detectors were provided and installed with picture
documentation confirmation.
Safety Alert #3: The home needed additional smoke detectors.
Resolution: Smoke detectors were provided and installed with picture
documentation confirmation.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
04/17/2025
